website_summaries.verdict: Great, programmable unit that is easy to use and has fantastic presets. Be very, very careful of the pot, though.
pros: It's advertised as a pressure cooker, but it can also sear, steam, sauté, and slow cook
Great digital display that changes colors as it cooks, releases steam, or pressurizes
cons: Pot can retain "taste" of previously cooked meals and has a delicate finish

website_summaries.verdict: If you want a high-performance electric pressure cooker that also gives you a slow cooker option, look no further.
pros: Offers 11 preset pressure cooking settings, plus a custom option, as well as a slow cooker feature
We love that the cooking bowl is both PTFE and PFOA free
Extremely easy to use with large LCD display

website_summaries.verdict: It's a well-built appliance with versatile cooking abilities and user-friendly features, but it's also a costly model with limited capacity.
pros: 11 settings, detachable cord, and automatic hands-free steam release
Owners rave about versatile cooking options that include sauteing, simmering, and steaming
cons: High price and a small cooking capacity
Unit tends to retain food odors

website_summaries.verdict: The Breville Fast Slow Pro is a solid all-in-one appliance that could replace some of your existing kitchen tools.
pros: The Breville Fast Slow Pro is a versatile multi-cooker that performs well under many scenarios, including searing meat, slow cooking and pressure cooking
cons: It's difficult to get a good seal on the lid when it's time to use the pressure cooker function
The Fast Slow Pro is $250, one of the pricier multicookers we've reviewed, but doesn't offer any app connectivity like similar products

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Product
customer_reviews.text: We used the unit less than 10 times in the past year. Broke down, doesn't heat. Bad product. Breville doesn't answer phone calls, so don't bother. Bad product, bad service, bad company. $250.00 not well spent. Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: robert parsons

customer_reviews.title: 3 months and broken need to return
customer_reviews.text: Solid quick meals until last week now will not work at all in any setting. Unfortunately 3 months old and no return policy 270 dollars later it’s going to the trash and I’m 100% Dissatisfied sure be nice if amazon would step on the replacement. Love breville but this thing was disappointing
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel lyon

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful machine, frustrating pressure failures
customer_reviews.text: Like many reviewers, I loved the intensity of the saute function and the less-goofy-than-the-Big-Brand look of this elegant multicooker. Sadly, it almost. never. worked. The pressure valve is so incredibly fiddly that 4 times out of 5 I'd wait over 30 minutes for the machine to reach pressure, only for it to cancel out, release all steam, and leave me with hot raw meat in a warm steamy sauce and people waiting at the dinner table. It looks so great, but this is clearly a widely-experienced issue. I wound up spending more time Googling variants of "Breville Fast Slo failed seal help" than actually cooking with it. In the end, I gave up and donated the thing.
customer_reviews.author: Grumplestiltskin

customer_reviews.title: Works 50% of the time
customer_reviews.text: Constantly get messages saying the lid is not closed when it is. Dont count on being able to use the pressure cooker. Get an instant pot instead
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Ordered new but got used :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to use this fast slow pro cooker until I open the box and realized I received a previously used item. There was obvious dried condensation on the steam release valve. I also noticed multiple blotchy dark marks on the outside of the cooker and scratch marks on the bottom corners of the cup that catches the condensation. For the price of this product I expect it to be perfect and quality. I did order a “new” not “used” item. I’m so disappointed and impatient. Returning this one ASAP. :/
customer_reviews.author: Alf

customer_reviews.title: Breville Pressure cooker failure
customer_reviews.text: Loved it while it was working. Loved the settings and functions. Did not last long and I paid big bucks for this machine. The LCD is dead and has no power now. I could of bought 3 cheaper similar products for the price I paid for the one. I will not be buying another from this company.
customer_reviews.author: Venus

customer_reviews.title: Get one now!
customer_reviews.text: One of the most used appliances in my kitchen. Breville makes wonderful products and this combo slow/pressure is no exception. Now, this item does not work for jarring/canning, but if that's not a deal breaker, this thing rocks. Risotto in no time at all, without constant watching? Check. Short ribs? Check. Sunday gravy in under 6 hours? Check. Dried beans? A total life saver. I love it. I love it so much that I've bought one for every family member that cooks. Get one now!
customer_reviews.author: Jezebel Impala

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly fine, but with the 5th time of use
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly fine, but with the 5th time of use. The product stopped working. I was making some risotto, and noticed that there wasn't any heat coming from the saute option. So I had to finish it in a pan, and then tried the pressure cooker option. No heat came from it!
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Insta Pot on Steroids
customer_reviews.text: Total control... that's what this thing is all about. The only reason that I didn't rate this on durability is that I haven't had it long enough to know; I've used it for about 6 months with no issues though. I could not be any happier with this cooker. So far I've done stocks, stews, meats, veggies, beans, and last weekend I cooked up a batch of a fantastic chile verde. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tutone

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE my Breville Fast Slow Pro!!!! It's so easy to use and cooks everything perfectly. I love the searing feature, right in the pot. Very user freindly. I did have to buy some cookbooks, but that's OK. My favorite Pressure Cooker one is: "the best pressure cooker recipes on the planet". People mentioned the gasket having a smell, even when you wash it, and I found this to be true. However, I honestly, barely notice it so don't let that tiny little negative hold you back. Like all Breville products, this is well worth the extra money!! I own 3 other Breville appliances and love them all.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Two years in and got E0 error
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for two years pretty frequently and all of the sudden started to get E0 message. After looking it up, it appears the pot is having problem pressurizing. Even with the o-ring replacement, it did not solve the issue. Took the lid locking component apart and found a broken wire. Repaired the wire and the E0 message is gone. 4-star overall, wiring quality used for lid component is questionable.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: My favorite kitchen item!
customer_reviews.text: On the recommendation of a chef friend, I have used one of these for about 2 years and it's absolutely my favorite cooking appliance. Liked it so much I bought one for my sister. If you like a slow cooker that isn't slow and doesn't make all the food taste the same - this is it! Very easy to use digital display. Can't screw it up.
customer_reviews.author: Active Family

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It is quite easy to use. I just set the type of soup I was cooking, and let it do its job. The option I chose showed that it’d take 20 minutes. This time appeared not enough to me, but I did not change it. It took some time to preheat and some time to release the pressure. At the end it took more than 20 minutes, but that would be the appropriate time to cook this soup. The results were delicious and I didn’t have to care about the cooking. I recommend this pot, but be aware that it is not magic. It will take time to preheat and to release pressure.
customer_reviews.author: XLIII_JA_Amazon_Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device that makes slow meals quick!
customer_reviews.text: For years I debated whether or not to get a pressure cooker. Finally pulled the trigger on the Fast Slow Pro last week. First meal I made in it was Beef Short Ribs. They took me about 90 minutes from start to finish including all chopping, slicing, browning. The meal was spectacular. I am so pleased with this purchase and can't wait to make something else in it. Clean up was fast and easy. Some others complain about the hinge on the right... Being a lefty this worked out GREAT for me.
customer_reviews.author: R. Adamo

customer_reviews.title: We loved it and used it regularly for a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an Xmas present for my wife. We loved it and used it regularly for a year. At exactly a year (when the warranty expired), we started having problems with the lid sealing. Then a chunk of the non-stick coating ripped off the pot surface. Then the heating element broke...and the unit does not heat, or build up pressure of course. Was nice while it lasted. Breville, the longevity of this appliance, needs major testing.
customer_reviews.author: Stilgar Al Mohandis

customer_reviews.title: Best machine out there and worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: What a great product. Easy to operate with plenty of functions. The interface is easily understood to customize any recipe. I don’t get how some people claims it’s hard? Really intuitive, especially if you familiarize yourself with the product. (Read the Owners Manual!) The machine is super easy to disassemble and clean. We made hard white beans to perfection in 30 minutes using the wonderful baked bean recipe. Product reeks of quality and I would buy it again. My wife loves it and she deserves the best.
customer_reviews.author: Dmac

customer_reviews.title: EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and spent a little more on a combination cooker and my wife loves it!. The quality of this product is evident. She had to get some receipt books and watch some YouTube videos but she's making some great stuff. Roast beef last Sunday was moist and tender. (Her best ever). The complaints about the lid smelling is true. We tried some different cleaners and solved that problem. Read the manual and watch videos to make the most of this cooker.
customer_reviews.author: Memphis Music Man

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, full control of cooking parameters
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality I have full control over temperature and time. Controls are easy to use and very precise like those of industrial equipment. I had other brand where the menu decides on how I should cook. I like to cook Asian food like Rendang, ginger duck, and a variety of curry. l like it’s features where I have full control over the cooking parameters. The food turns out to be just as good as those from restaurants. Tried pork soup with Chinese herbs, yummy . Canitas wow, Beef stew, tender and juicy Saves me tons of money eating out.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: Temperamental and will only add to your time of cooking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased your pressure cooker on Amazon about 2 years ago. I paid way more than an instant pot because I believed in Breville brand, but unfortunately its performance was so disappointing. It’s temperamental from the beginning and I often got the error msg of “lid not sealed”. Check everything over and over, and the problem just keeps happening. I stopped using it because it wastes my time cooking instead of saving time. I am truly disappointed. For the price I paid for your pressure cooker I could have gotten 3 instant pots. How do you justify? I finally got an instant pot and it runs smoothly and truly saves me hours of cooking time.
customer_reviews.author: GH

customer_reviews.title: Broken after 1.5 years of use
customer_reviews.text: It is uncommon for me to leave product review, but this situation is exceptional. I bought such Slow Cooker about 3 years ago. It worked for 1 year and 2 month. Got broken, and of cause it is not covered by the 1-year warranty. Ok, bad luck, not big deal. Ordered exactly same item. Guess what? Broken after 1 year and 3 months of usage.
customer_reviews.author: Marina

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding at high altitude
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic addition to our kitchen. Used at 9114 feet altitude. Directions state not to use over 6500 feet but it works perfectly and makes cooking easy and fast at altitude where boiling is at a temperature lower than 212 degrees. Rice in 6 minutes, soups with beans in 20 minutes, awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Flyer

customer_reviews.title: Breville does not support all it's products
customer_reviews.text: No replacement gaskets. Has not been one available for months. I know and understand we are in unusual times with covid and all, but at least they should post some comment, Let their customers know they actually care about them. e.g. "We can't get the gaskets but we are trying other sources". What does Breville do? They just remove the gasket from the 'parts replacement list' It's a good product, but be prepared to have to toss it when the gasket no longer seals.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Giachelli

customer_reviews.title: Lid not sealed issues, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Worked several times for saute and pressure cooking then when trying to use pressure cooker, it kept displaying "Lid not sealed". We checked the gasket, wiped everything clean, checked the alignment, everything in the troubleshooting guide. Nothing worked. Called customer service where we were put into a very long wait queue. Returning it and getting an Instant Pot.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT L.

customer_reviews.title: then it worked fine. The gasket is a little tough to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: All functions work well. Controls are intuitive. Did have one episode of trouble getting cooker up to pressure. Had to reseat the gasket and screw the lid on again, then it worked fine. The gasket is a little tough to fit under the wire rim that contains it, but not a problem once you get used to doing it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda M. DuBois, PA

customer_reviews.title: High Altitude Issue - Is not to be used above 6500 ft!
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed to find out when reading the directions for use that this multi cooker should not be used above 6500 feet in elevation. I live at 8000 feet and was hoping the multipot/pressure cooker would be able to help with some cooking issues we have here and also save a little propane (which is super expensive). Never used it so my 1-star rating is solely based on the elevation issue.
customer_reviews.author: susan baumgartner

customer_reviews.title: Great fast slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I love love my Breville fast slow cooker! So easy to use after knowing buttons and reading manual. I have a regular pressure cooker I used a lot but this is so much easier it comes to pressure cooks and releases all by itself which I so great. I wish they had a 8 quart but 6 is good. Yes it's a lot to pay but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Lovecactus

customer_reviews.title: Great once sealed
customer_reviews.text: Works well once you figure out how to get the lid to seal. We had to go over and push down the first few times to get the pressure seal to take hold. After a few times the unit now seals itself consistently so it's set and forget.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: New way to cook for us
customer_reviews.text: Have used this a couple of times so far and love it! Some have written that they are disappointed by the warm up times (and so they feel miss led). Of course it takes a few minutes to warm up or build pressure! Does you oven or stove top come up to temp instantly? This is really easy to use and very well built. Can't wait to fix some more meals in it.
customer_reviews.author: L Shaefer

customer_reviews.title: This is a beautiful pot.
customer_reviews.text: It works so well, I love it. The inner pot is not teflon coated, it is a ceramic coating that is extremely non-stick. Excellent pot.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cooker! I bought it recently and have now ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooker ! I bought it recently and have now used it for many meals . I find it very easy and enjoyable to use , and the recipes turn out beautifully . The automatic settings eliminate guesswork from pressure cooking and are precise . It's versatile with many functions. Build is high quality . Although more expensive than others it's worth it- you will use it a lot and it will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: TMatthew77

customer_reviews.title: Automatic Pressure Release And Versatility
customer_reviews.text: This is a very versatile appliance. It is a little fussier than the Instant Pot getting the lid to seal, and the Instant Pot is a smidgen faster to heat up, but this has dual heat sensors - in the base and the lid, and it has automatic pressure release which I really like. It is well made - it's a Breville! I still use the Instant Pot for yogurt and bone broth because of the instant cycles, but I appreciate the low simmer setting on the Breville.
customer_reviews.author: IthacaNancy

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Not only elegant and easy to use with the digital display but sturdy and precise. I love it. Everything I cooked with it was tender and delicious. Also healthy with ceramic coated pot. Plus is extremely easy to clean. Very happy with my purchase. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I now love what I can prepare in this beautiful Breville
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit nervous about using a pressure cooker. I now love what I can prepare in this beautiful Breville. I have done Apple sauce, beans and meat my family has not complained about any of them.
customer_reviews.author: Beekeeper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product, worth its price
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful product. This is my first pressure/slow cooker but I fell in love with it. It is well done and looks very nice. All my meals are a hit and it saves a lot of time! Very easy and intuitive to use, has a lot of default settings to help you figure out how long you need to cook specific food. There is even an option of adjusting the pressure depending on the altitude you live at (and ours is significant). So far I have had no complaints about the product. Breville is a brand in itself and has never disappointed us.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best home electric slow cooker available at this time!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this a long time ago! PROS: 1. Very Versatile. Pressure cooks, slow cooks, sears, etc. 2. Very easy to use. 3. Saves a whole lot of time by cutting down lengthy meal preps by well over half in many cases. 4. Makes meals more enjoyable (i.e. tastier, more tender, etc.). 5. Easy to clean. 6. Excellent display/screen. 7. Handsome look. 8. Apparently good build quality. 9. Comes with basic cook book. CONS: 1. Expensive. 2. Capacity adequate but, not impressive. A bit more volume would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: George King

customer_reviews.title: Pricey but worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the pressure cooker mode several times a week and always with perfect results. I have had other pressure cookers that were adequate but the Breville is over the top!
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Very Used Friendly and Versatile
customer_reviews.text: I love Breville products and this slow cooker/pressure cooker is awesome. They did a good job on making it easy to use and took my anxiety about cooking with pressure away. I feel it is very safe if you follow the instructions. The reason I gave it 4 stars is that the silicone gasket smells of onions and I cannot get the smell out.
customer_reviews.author: JPM in AK

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Love this cooker, it is one of my best investments. I highly recommend it. Breville only makes high quality items and this is proof.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pot !!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe how awesome it is. Beans are done in 55 min. Amazing features. Nice Quality, easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Maria A.

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Used this product 5 times since I bought in 2016. It smoke the electrical and now won't power up.what a waste of money. Breville used to be a great product. Not so much anymore. Update: Contacted Breville and they replaced the unit within a week. Now if they only made a stainless insert pot.
customer_reviews.author: NotSoFast

customer_reviews.title: Has a Steamer too
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. It also replaces a rice-cooker, steamer. It really does it all for a decluttered tiny kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Liang

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pressure/Slow Cooker!
customer_reviews.text: Love My Breville Pressure/Slow cooker. I've used it for cooking all kinds of stews, soups, chicken/beef/veggie recipes and does it all. Easy to clean, great quality, and worth the extra money for something that last long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazoniac

customer_reviews.title: I love this machine
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. Opens up so many more possibilities to do quickly. Easy and safe to operate. Just wish the recipe book was bigger and more for American market. Be careful not to follow recipe times which seem to overcook meats perhaps because this is from Australia.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Everything comes out so tender and very easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this for about a month and made 2 dinners a week in it they turned out so good. Cleaning is very easy. We decided to go with Breville because we have one of there coffee makers and are very happy with it. Takes a little time to get to pressure but cooks in a little time under pressure. The meat is so tender and juicy and you brown the meat and make every thing right in the pot. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: I like the simple interface
customer_reviews.text: I cook all the time with this! I like the simple interface...and it cleans up so well. Not sure how this compares to instapot, but I think they nailed the seal and the electronics.
customer_reviews.author: EPS inc

customer_reviews.title: Takes a while to warm or heat up
customer_reviews.text: Works good but a little expensive maybe I should have shopped around
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Makes yummy easy
customer_reviews.text: Love all the things I can do in one unit - have seared, reduced, slow cooked and pressure cooked and everything is easy and comes out great!
customer_reviews.author: adw

customer_reviews.title: Really great pressure cooker.
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to our kitchen as it frees up a burner on the stove. Super easy cleanup with the lid that can come off easily to be washed. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Aceves-Mittman

customer_reviews.title: Don’t like cooking?
customer_reviews.text: This product is a life saver! Love it! If you want to make the perfect anything to eat, easy and save money? Go for it! Little expensive but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: The Hamadto’s

customer_reviews.title: Full featured, solidly built.
customer_reviews.text: This has all the features you want and is fairly intuitive to operate after a brief read of the guide to see all the features including the capabilities of making changes once cooking has started.
customer_reviews.author: Carl W

customer_reviews.title: Aggrieved customer
customer_reviews.text: The packaging for the product is super. The product itself has an air of quality and beauty around it. Sending it back was not easy for me, but must it should. There was no problem sending it. This product could have got a five from me, but for non-use.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel K Losu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: This is my number one kitchen appliance at home. I use it for almost everything. Excellent quality like most products from Breville.
customer_reviews.author: Hermes

customer_reviews.title: great cooking gadget
customer_reviews.text: Not the perfect way to cook everything but excellent for many recipes. well made, easy interface.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: should have bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: rice, roast, chicken, BBQ, soup and many more... what an incredible machine! love love love It!
customer_reviews.author: Robert G

customer_reviews.title: Just What We Expected.
customer_reviews.text: Press the button and BAM! Dinner is ready in minutes. We are pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Im-MEL-da

customer_reviews.title: Using twice weekly
customer_reviews.text: I love to cook and cook every Sunday. This cooker has shortened time in the kitchen and produced some very tasty dishes 👍
customer_reviews.author: Avid Learner

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love this pressure cooker! Makes the best frozen chicken breast! Makes a great slow cooker too! Works better than any slow cooker I️ own!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie

customer_reviews.title: Breville products are wonderful. This is my third appliance and the quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Breville products are wonderful. This is my third appliance and the quality is great. I like that you can do so many things with this appliance.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnn

customer_reviews.title: Breville has done it again!
customer_reviews.text: Great cooker! We've always been highly satisfied with the Breville brand, and this didn't let us down. We cooked an entire chicken in a short amount of time, came out delicious and juicy! The reduction for the sauce worked great! Rice always comes out perfect! Well worth the money, and highly recommend! We've had ours for over a year (I can't remember the exact date we got it), and it's still running perfectly. We did find with one of our recipes that the odor was retained, but after cleaning with a vinegar solution, it was back to normal. This is staple in our household to this day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty neat. Very solid. Good user interface. Cannot make yogurt because it lacks a low-temperature setting.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Breville is the best
customer_reviews.text: This is my first time using a pressure cooker. It helps me doing things fast. I don’t have to worry keeping something on the stove.
customer_reviews.author: Georges V. Pelissier

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my boyfriend and I used more than he does. It’s safe and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rubi Lajas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: best pressure cooker by far my wife love s it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is not your grandmother's pressure cooker! Works well for both slow and fast cook, and the browning pot means you don't end up with an awful mess from browning the meat.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: So far I love this. The instructions are very clear and it's easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine L. Pendleton

customer_reviews.title: Inner pot retains food odor
customer_reviews.text: Tried everything, still has the strong food odor from last cook
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Breville slow cooker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my wife and I've use it twice and its amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony smith

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, downfall is the actual cooking pot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an Instant Pot. I LOVE the programmable hands free pressure release. Sadly, the cooking pot is a problem. It retains food odor (especially if you use cumin...) they suggest a cleaning cycle with water and lemon juice; this reduced the odor but did not eliminate it. Then I noticed a scratch at the bottom of the pot...despite the fact that I am super careful with all my non-stick cookware; use nothing but silicone utensils, wash only with a microfiber sponge. If only they would make this with a stainless steel pot like the Instant Pot it would be the most perfect machine ever.
customer_reviews.author: CMB

customer_reviews.title: You need this!!
customer_reviews.text: I own a majority of the units made by Breville and this one doesn't disappoint. I owned the previous model and I was impressed, but the Pro takes it one to two steps further by enabling the unit to self vent, the inclusion of an LCD, and just overall AWESOMENESS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Clinton

customer_reviews.title: and I have got to say that I love it, and so does the wife
customer_reviews.text: This pot is outstanding, we have used it several times now, and I have got to say that I love it, and so does the wife.
customer_reviews.author: SCOTT CODY BEARDALL

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work at high elevations
customer_reviews.text: I enthusiastically purchased this pressure cooker after reading about it in the New York Times. I was impressed that it could be adjusted for higher altitudes. It gave direction on how to adjust it for higher elevations. But the next sentence said it should not be used above 6,000 feet. I live at 7,000 ft. I called Breville, and they confirmed that it would not work at this elevation. Wish that had been mentioned in the description.
customer_reviews.author: Elinor S Schrader

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Have to change 5 starts to a below ONE START!! this product started to acting out withing the FIRST month of use: a disconnect of the lid almost EVERY time of cooking and finally it stopped working after LESS THAN A YEAR OF A LIGHT USE!! what a scam and an afull quality!! DO NOT BUY..
customer_reviews.author: Anya

customer_reviews.title: Go big or go home... forget the instapot
customer_reviews.text: I have the original Breville. I purchased this one so I could cook in both cookers. This one is awesome. Some people complained about the removal of the top or the opening of it. But I am a leftie, so it could not be better. Got one for my sister and my mother, as well. Breville makes the best products.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just like all the Breville products, a beautiful piece of kitchen equipment.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: this is by far my favorite kitchen appliance
customer_reviews.text: this is by far my favorite kitchen appliance. It keeps slow-cooked foods moist, great for browning or sauteing then either slow or pressure cook meals. I absolutely love this device and have since given one as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kitchen addition!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome versatile and easy to use! Love this gadget! Pot roast in 30 minutes. Easiest beef stew in 30 min. Just throw all the incgredients in and press the button. Delicious meals that would typically take hours to cook - ready in less than an hour! We have one and bought one as a gift for a relative. They love it too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love Breville!!
customer_reviews.text: Love, Love, Love this appliance! It is simply amazing! We can slow cook or use the pressure cooker! It is simply amazing! It's fast, quiet, extremely efficient! How did we ever live without one, I'll never know! We have other Breville appliances & find them all to be worth the cost & very functional & convenient to use!! Great products!!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Love this Pressure Cooker
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this machine! It is changing the way we cook.
customer_reviews.author: TreeTop

customer_reviews.title: I loved this. I bought it as a Christmas present ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved this. I bought it as a Christmas present for myself last year on December 14. I've pressure cooked and slow cooked my way through 2017. Why one star? Yesterday, three days out of warranty, it stopped working. I'm replacing it with the much-less expensive Instant Pot.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Karl

customer_reviews.title: best ive ever had and super easy 40 mins and ...
customer_reviews.text: Just did a pot roast , OMG!!!! best ive ever had and super easy 40 mins and done, very happy
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful work of art from Breville! Love this machine, it's amazing!
customer_reviews.author: JOJO E. WOLAK

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. It does everything from pressure cook to reduce, sear, slow cook, sauté etc etc. I am not concerned about about the big pot being coated. I have all the coated tools to whisk, serve, strain. It looks really spiffy sitting on my counter. As it is electric, I am not using a ring on my stove at holiday times.
customer_reviews.author: dee

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this wonderful kitchen helper. We can have risotto in just a few minutes, honestly!
customer_reviews.author: Tutu

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT SUCKS LID DOES NOT CLOSE BREVILLE HORRIBLE COMPANY!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Only half of the cord was in the box. I can't use it.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't like it...So far...I tried to pressure cook a bottom round roast using a recipe that required adaptation. The documentation with the Breville Fast Slow Pro is inadequate, although I didn't follow one of their recipes. I am so confused about the cooker reaching the proper temperature, how long I need to cook the roast, the LCD display, when to release the steam, etc. There are so many options that my head is spinning right now. I tried to call them and their office is closed during their advertised office hours. Gr-r-r-r.
customer_reviews.author: Lucille Joan Kalinske

customer_reviews.title: Lid not sealed problem SOLVED
customer_reviews.text: I finally figured out my own "lid not sealed" problem...it was the pressure relief valve on the top of the lid which was not properly aligned. It needs to be seated and face the lid knob as shown on page 17 of the BPR700 manual (US) which is step 8 of the pressure cooking directions. The pressure relief valve on top is not the same as the "safety locking pin" that is aligned when you lock the lid. While this is very obvious in many ways now in retrospect, I think many poor reviews overlooked this step as I did. PS I've only tried a few recipes so far but all have been great so far!
customer_reviews.author: G Has Smart Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Major deal breaker
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not checking before buying. The lid arm is permanently attached to the pot!?!? This is totally unnecessary and awkward, in that the top will be right there when you are trying to saute and sear meat. Why do some people think that they need to do things so different in order to just stand out? BREVILLE... I could have purchased two more instant pots and had money left over, for what I paid for your product... just to be faced with this design farce. Will not recommend nor buy anything made by breville ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smells a little off
customer_reviews.text: We used this product twice. We cleaned it promptly after each use. Unfortunately the unit still smells strongly of the spices used in the previous dishes. I removed the top and cleaned the seal. The internal non-stick pan and the housing itself still smell. There is no visual evidence of any food contamination, but I can't help but wonder if accumulated smells will eventually start affecting the flavor of future dishes. Very disappointed in this device due to this issue.
customer_reviews.author: TeeTwo

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 18 months.
customer_reviews.text: It is a great product! I have used it a lot to cook, sear, steam. BUT today it broke - heating element stopped working, after year and a half of usage ( once every two-three weeks). For a good brand Breville is - it is very disappointing, to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Yuliya S.

customer_reviews.title: Loved it .... until it stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Had this cooker for 2 years, used it 1-2x/wk, nicely made, lovely for beans. Got rid of my crockpot as I no longer needed it. Loved it until it failed today, died while cooking dal this morning :( Never dropped or mishandled and was only on a 5 min cycle. Assuming burnt fuse or electrical component but who knows? Live in Hawaii so shipping cost likely prohibitive for repairs and out of warranty. A little more versatile than instapot but given the price difference and longevity, won’t be repurchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pressure Cooking Adventures Await!
customer_reviews.text: Husband gave me one for my birthday. I was not excited until we used it last night to make ribs in under 30 minutes! Wow this pot has amazing features and electric pressure cooking is a new adventure! Set up was fairly easy (husband took care of this) and cooking in the pot was simple. Kitchen smelled so good! Clean up afterwards was also easy. It is rather large and heavy so needs its own place in the kitchen if you become a devoted user (buy a separate cart on wheels). Also the Instant Pot community on facebook is a wonderful source of ways to use the pot, shared by devotees of electric pressure cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Make Sure You Do Not Lose The Bolt To The Lid
customer_reviews.text: Buyer Beware. Make sure you do no lose the bolt to the lid. If you happen to lose the bolt to the lid it is nearly impossible to get a replacement part. You may have to wait months. I called Breville directly and they do not even know when they will have a supply. The lid assembly that is available for purchase does not come with a bolt to keep the lid in place. You cannot use the cooker without the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: She was a Beauty!
customer_reviews.text: We loved using our Breville Fast Slow Pro since purchasing last June 2017. Pressure cooker stopped working 1 month ago before it completely stopped working all together. It’s now November 2018 and unsure of my service options but less expensive to buy anew otherwise. She was a beauty when she ‘twas alive.
customer_reviews.author: \o/

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working one month out of warranty
customer_reviews.text: One month out of warranty my unit no longer works. It comes almost up to pressure and then plummets. I see no visible signs of a seal issue, but that doesn't matter because electronics inside control everything. This is one of the more expensive multi cookers out there and complete failure so soon is a hard pill to swallow. This will definitely make me think twice about buying any other big ticket Breville items in the future, which is a shame because they make some cool looking stuff.
customer_reviews.author: ECDad

customer_reviews.title: This pressure cooker is AMAZING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This pressure cooker is AMAZING!!! We've never had one before and were, frankly, a little scared... what if pressure got too high and it blew up, etc. But this gem walks you through every step, showing you the time remaining on each one and EVERY SINGLE THING we have cooked in it was perfect. The pressure cooker was critical to us because of special dietary needs that could only be met by pressure cooking the foods. It's a blessing. Yes, it was expensive, but in this case, it's worth it!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Brandt Jr.

customer_reviews.title: What an amazing product
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a pressure cooker I cannot recommend this Breville product enough. It is light years ahead of my other kitchen appliances.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Van Scherpe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cooker with one little con
customer_reviews.text: Great cooker! I've made a lot of meals in it since I've got it: stews, corn, soups, rice, etc. Very easy to use, easy to clean. The only thing that bothers me a bit - the inside pot seems to take in all the aromas of the cooked food and it stays there no matter how good I clean it, either it's hand washed or in a dishwasher. Not sure why is it so.
customer_reviews.author: Iraya

customer_reviews.title: makes wonderful stews and great for otherwise long-cooking vegetables like artichokes
customer_reviews.text: Really attractive and works perfectly. The only downside is that the silicon sealing ring retains food odors and therefore requires some extra attention from time to time. The only other downsides are the general downsides of pressure cooking, notably that you can't taste and season while the cooking process is going, and while much faster than stovetop, still takes a while for pressure to build. Still, makes wonderful stews and great for otherwise long-cooking vegetables like artichokes, and so I am using it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: City Girl

customer_reviews.title: What's not to like...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product by an excellent company. I made some yummy short ribs and got a wonderful base for a sauce from the braising liquid (just had to reduce to the consistency I wanted). Made a very tasty wild boar tenderloin and a tomato sauce simultaneously. Naturally I needed to reduce the sauce after the tenderloin was done. But it could all be done in the Breville. One pot cooking at its finest. The nice thing is the boar added wonderful flavor to the tomato sauce. And it makes rice cooking a breeze. Best of all, clean up is so fast and easy. Very happy I spent a little more and got a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: John S

product_meta.title: Breville BPR700BSS Fast Slow Pro Multi Function Cooker, Brushed Stainless Steel
product_meta.description: The combination pressure and slow cooker that knows the time, temperature and pressure. Some foods are tender with time, others are tastier under pressure, but how to know the exact pressure, temperature and time different foods need ? Its all possible with the 'Fast Slow Pro' a multicore unit with pressure and slow cook menus that automatically adjust time, temperature and pressure between fast and slow cooking. The dual sensors at the top and bottom monitor ingredients for more accurate temperature and pressure control, while the hands free steam release automatically to maximize flavor and texture. You can pressure cook, slow cook, steam, reduce, sauteacute; and sear with the press of a button. Rely on the fully interactive LCD to tell you when its building pressure, cooking and releasing steam. Voltage - 110–120 Volts
feature_bullets: Color changing LCD tells you when the cooker is pressurizing, cooking or releasing steam
3 Way Safety System/Safety locking lid, automatic hands free steam release, safety valve
11 pressure cook settings plus a custom setting to suit your favorite recipes
Keep Warm function turns on after cooking so food is ready to serve when you are
Removable cooking bowl with PTFE and PFOA free ceramic coating
Capacity : 6 quart – 4.5 qt (MAX), 1 quart (MIN).Dimensions:12.5 x 13.5 x 14 inches

Full feedback LCD display tells you whats going on inside the pot with a pressure indicator, temperature and countdown timer and steam release indicator. 8 pressure levels range from 1.5 psi to 12 psi.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars520 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
